page.title: 02AREA HISTORY TO MID 19th.C.
page.content: Much of the land, subsequently divided, was first owned by the Massey Family but was re_united by 1850 to the{Earls of Stamford}of Dunham Hall. Many buildings in the area have a 17th. Century farming heritage, e.g. {Ollerbarrow Farm,}now a shop. Farms have always been important to the local economy. Early houses,{Victorian {Gothic Villas,}were first built for Manchester's retired professional people, doctors, businessmen etc. The old age pensioners of the "cottage" tea club alongside Hale's bowling green provided the Survey team with much help and had pleasant memories of the area before it became dominated by the shops and the motor car. Their favourite memory was of walking everywhere: to school, church and even to work on the nearby farms.
